qas.question: What did the foundation decide not to fund

answers.text: has decided not to fund abortion"

qas.question: WHy did they decide not to fund abortion

answers.text: the emotional and personal debate about abortion is threatening to get in the way of the lifesaving consensus regarding basic family planning

qas.question: Before 2013 the foundation gave how how much to planned parenthood

qas.question: Who decided not to fund basic family planning?

plausible_answers.text: the emotional and personal debate about abortion

qas.question: In 2013 what debate did Bill Gates say is in the way of family planning?
How much did Bill & Melinda Gates donate for family planning up to 2013?
What affiliated organization is the primary US abortion provider?
What issue did Bill Gates say he struggled with in 2014?

context: <b3_0>Melinda Gates<b3_0/> has stated that the foundation "<a0_0>has decided not to fund <b7_0>abortion<b7_0/>"<a0_0/>. In response to questions about this decision, Gates stated in a June 2014 blog post that she "struggle[s] with the issue" and that "<a1_0><b4_0>the emotional and personal debate about abortion<b4_0/> is threatening to get in the way of the lifesaving consensus regarding basic family planning<a1_0/>". <a2_0>Up to 2013, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation provided <b5_0>$71 million<b5_0/> to <b6_0>Planned Parenthood<b6_0/><a2_0/>, the primary U.S. abortion provider, and affiliated organizations.
